description:
Checkstyle is a development tool to help programmers write Java code that adheres to a coding standard. It automates the process of checking Java code to spare humans of this boring (but important) task. This makes it ideal for projects that want to enforce a coding standard.

Checkstyle is highly configurable and can be made to support almost any coding standard. An example configuration files are supplied supporting the Sun Code Conventions, Google Java Style.

----

Due to changes in the Java 8 package, you may have to set your own `%JAVA_HOME%` environment variable. Checkstyle is a JAR and, as you can see in the included `checkstyle.bat` file, we have to run the checkstyle JAR through the `java` command.
summary: Checkstyle is a development tool to help programmers write Java code that adheres to a coding standard.
